data.title: g3d Fatal Error in VoxelTest
data.body:
Just starting out with 3d, I was running the VoxelTest, and I get a fatal error:

Java frames: (J=compiled Java code, j=interpreted, Vv=VM code)
j  sun.misc.Unsafe.copyMemory(Ljava/lang/Object;JLjava/lang/Object;JJ)V+0
J  java.nio.Bits.copyFromArray(Ljava/lang/Object;JJJJ)V
j  java.nio.DirectShortBufferU.put([SII)Ljava/nio/ShortBuffer;+129
j  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.IndexBufferObject.setIndices([SII)V+20
j  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh.setIndices([S)Lcom/badlogic/gdx/graphics/Mesh;+8
j  com.badlogic.gdx.tests.g3d.voxel.VoxelWorld.<init>([Lcom/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g2d/TextureRegion;III)V+347
j  com.badlogic.gdx.tests.g3d.voxel.VoxelTest.create()V+228
j  com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication.mainLoop()V+29
j  com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run()V+27
v  ~StubRoutines::call_stub

I noticed changing the chunksize parameters from 16 to 8 makes this issue no longer occur.  But if its set to the 16 for x y and z it immediately throws:

 EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x78852357, pid=45744, tid=22180

at the java line above.  Same issue on multiple machines.  Full dump below:

data.title: Override equals and hashCode on FileHandle
data.body:
I wanted to start a discussion around this commit, since I'm not sure we necessarily want to make this change.

Today, one cannot use `fileHandle.equals(otherFileHandle)` to determine if the two FIleHandle instances refer to the same file. While this is easy to get around by comparing the type and the path separately, this doesn't work in cases where one does not have control over the comparison (such as in a Collection#contains call).

I don't think this would cause problems for folks, but since I can't foresee every use case, I figured it best to discuss.

Thoughts?

data.title: Add method to Intersector to get the intersecting rectangle formed by 2 overlapping rectangles
Added new constructor and setter for Vector3
data.body:
Hi,

I have added an new constructor for Vector3 so it can be constructed by a Vector2 and a float z-component. There is a similar setter as well. This changes are useful to me since I often switch between 2D and 3D. Maybe this is useful for others too? :)

data.title: ObjectSet and IntSet: some shortcuts for empty sets
data.body:
ObjectSet#contains will always perform the maximum amount of work if the set is empty, i.e. it goes through all  hashes and checks the stash. This can be shortened if the size is known to be zero.

Also added it to the remove method and IntSet.

data.title: Quaternion.setFromAxes() does not work for scaled matrices
data.body: Quaternion.setFromAxes() (and therefore Quaternion.setFromMatrix() and Matrix4.getRotation()) does not produce correct results for scaled matrices. A proposed fix is to normalize all axes, although this might not be a good idea for performance reasons.

data.title: Memory leak loading music or sound with AssetManager
data.body:
Instruments can detect a memory leak if I use an AssetManager to load sounds or music like that:

am.load("sound/somesound.wav", Sound.class);  //am.update() is called on render(..)

calling am.finishLoading(); immediately after that line does not help.

what's interesting is that creating a sound or music like this:

music = Gdx.audio.newMusic(Gdx.files.internal("sound/somemusic.mp3"));

does not create a memory leak.

![bildschirmfoto 2013-10-09 um 23 48 23](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2501804/1302045/c62039e8-312c-11e3-87ed-a885d0677a57.png)

data.title: various bullet changes
Added a void circle builder (circleLine) to create a simple circle line
data.body:
Added a void circle builder (circleLine) to create a simple circle line without any faces.
Used the original code to avoid duplications.

I would prefer to replace circle by disk and use circle instead of circleLine, but it seems dangerous for people already using circle, it would be a bad surprise...

data.title: Stretched Sprite does not render with constant height
add toString method for FloatCounter
Visible Property (Get/Set)
data.body: I think is a good thing the ModelInstance have a Visible Property (setVisible, isVisible) to quick show/hide models in a collection to draw.

data.title: Various, mostly meshbuilder ensure size
Update WaterRipples.java
Add getter for TiledMap (width, height, tilewidth, tileheight)
data.body:
Hello.

I think it will be more simple if this methods was directly implemented in TiledMap class :) .

Width, Height, TileWidth and TileHeight are initialized in the loader.

data.title: Json deserialization of Map<K,V> broken
data.body:
In commit 841f50b233da7da97f67e24893093d3e10400b87 metadata code was changed in the method `public FieldMetadata (Field field)` in gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/utils/Json.java. 

In that commit, a special case was added for the types ObjectMap and HashMap, but the interface Map which is implemented by HashMap was left out. As a result, when deserializing a field of type Map, the value data was expected to be of the key type, and it could no longer be deserialized. We hotfixed this by temporarily changing the type of the field to HashMap. As far as I can see, this should be a trivial fix by adding the type Map to the ternary operation that special cases the Map types:

``` java
int index = (ClassReflection.isAssignableFrom(ObjectMap.class, field.getType()) || ClassReflection.isAssignableFrom(HashMap.class, field.getType()) || ClassReflection.isAssignableFrom(Map.class, field.getType())) ? 1 : 0;
```

data.title: Bits optimization: No need to loop 64 bits if word is known to be 0
Added Bits#getAndClear, Bits#getAndSet and Bits#containsAll
data.body: Also made some variables local in other methods.

data.title: ScissorStack.calculateScissors is incorrect
data.body: ScissorStack.calculateScissors calculate the region of clipping without using the viewport. Therefore, This method is incorrect when I set another viewport.

data.title: ran gdx-tools HeaderFixer tool
data.body: ant build succesful

data.title: monster insertion of Apache license headers
data.body:
This is a crazy PR, let me explain it:

I added a python script: `find-missing-apache-headers.py`
https://github.com/jrenner/libgdx/blob/insert-apache-header/find-apache.py
 in the base libgdx directory (don't know where else to put it).  This script will find any source files (currently only .java, but configurable) that are missing the Apache header under the libgdx dir tree.  It then gives you the option to insert the header.  This PR is the result of running that script. I was able to do the ant build sucessfully after running the script.

Things I don't know about:
- Do all these files need the header?  I don't know about box2d, bullet, other third party stuff.
- Does anyone really care about this?
- What other source extensions does this need to work for?

All in all I think I just wanted to write some python.  My feelings won't be hurt at all if this gets closed without a merge.

data.title: Mavan build on clean repository is not working
data.body:
1. clean out com/badlogicgames from your Maven repository
2. run 'mvn clean install'
   
   ```
   $ mvn clean install
   [INFO] Scanning for projects...
   [ERROR] The build could not read 2 projects -> [Help 1]

   [ERROR]     Non-resolvable parent POM: Could not find artifact com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-parent:pom:0.9.9-SNAPSHOT and 'parent.relativePath' points at wrong local POM @ line 4, column 13 -> [Help 2]
   [ERROR]

   [ERROR]     Non-resolvable parent POM: Could not find artifact com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-parent:pom:0.9.9-SNAPSHOT and 'parent.relativePath' points at wrong local POM @ line 4, column 13 -> [Help 2]

   ```

It works if there is an older build already present in the local repository.

data.title: add Apache headers to new files
data.body: stupid

data.title: Scen2d Dialog: stageBackground from atlas file does not cover whole stage
More documentation needed for JSON
data.body: Some comments on readFields, readValue and setElementType would be nice. I couldn't figure out how they work.

data.title: Scen2d Dialog: stageBackground does not cover whole stage
Added abs functions to MathUtils for returning absolute value of an int ...
data.body:
Absolute function for MathUtils. Works with float or int.

Tested both.

data.title: Image are flipped in Particle Editor preview window
data.body:
To Reproduce:
- open particle editor
- open any image
- image is shown flipped upside down

However, when particle is saved then loaded from file image is shown normal.

It's also mentioned in this thread:
http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=3370&p=16574&hilit=particle+flipped#p16574

data.title: Actions on Labels affect all elements drawn by the same SpriteBatch
Scene2DUI scroll bars can change sides, implement scrollbar test, format tests list
data.body:
Three changes:
- vertical and horizontal scroll bars in scene2d ui can be set to left/right, or top/bottom respectively.
  ![2013-10-06-124525_642x509_scrot](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1393288/1276149/28b6db2c-2e42-11e3-9220-6d7fbb419277.png)
- implemented a test for scroll bars (ScrollPaneScrollBarsTest in above pic)
- formatted and alphabetized the list of tests in utils.GdxTests (better readability, easier to add new tests)

If anyone has a project/game with ScrollPane it would be nice if you could test changing the scroll bar locations with these two methods:
- setVScrollBarAtRight(false);
- setHScrollBarAtBottom(false);
